result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dominique Damario Merriweather

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dominique Damario Merriweather in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Dominique Damario Merriweather.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 15 for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominique Damario Merriweather in Court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in Court for Dominique Damario Merriweather.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Defense requested a plea/sentencing hearing. Court granted request. Court VACATED Jury Trial date. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 15. Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.

Defendant Dominique Damario Merriweather in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Defense advises the court case is in trial posture and  request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dominique Damario Merriweather in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dominique Damario Merriweather in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Dominique Damario Merriweather in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dominique Damario Merriweather appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
